channel.title: SCSM 2012 on Fletcher Kelly | Cloud Engineer
channel.description: Recent content in SCSM 2012 on Fletcher Kelly | Cloud Engineer

item.title: Auto-Closing work items made easy–Service Manager 2012
item.description: So, there are a few ways of tackling the issue of automatically closing Incidents/Change Requests within Service Manager.

item.title: Exchange Connector – SCSM 2012
item.description: So, I decided to extend the functionality of Service Manager even more with the Exchange Connector.

item.title: Upgrading from SCSM 2010 / SCSM 2012 PRE-RTM to SCSM 2012 RTM
item.description: So, You are now ready to take the plunge and upgrade to SCSM 2012 RTM as it now “publically” available.

item.title: Service Manager 2012 Management Server (Upgrade)
item.description: So, for the Management Server. This was very easy and quite painless for me. Backup Encryption Key (for Disaster Recovery Purposes) Install Windows Server 2008 R2 SP1 (This is a pre-requisite for SCSM 2012) Remove Operations Manager Agent if this is installed, as the installer WILL stop you from continuing if the OpsMan Agent is installed.

item.title: Service Manager 2012 Data Warehouse (Upgrade)
item.description: So, my journey with System Centre Service Manager 2012 Beta has begun and so far I have indeed found some funnies.
